intro: Claytonia flagellaris, commonly known as the flagellate springbeauty, is a delicate flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and typically grows in moist, rocky soils in mountainous regions. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are usually pink or white, with five petals that curve backward, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are succulent and often have a waxy coating to retain moisture. Claytonia flagellaris is often found in open habitats such as meadows and streambanks, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
